page.title: 10Cofton Hall
page.content: {Cofton Hall}is a historic building situated to the South East of Cofton Hackett. The cellars at Cofton Hall are over 900 years old and it was mentioned in the {original Domesday Book.}They were used to store food and drink. There are seven rooms in the cellars. The present hall was built in the{15th {Century.} The rest of the house was rebuilt after Royalist soldiers burnt it down after the Battle of Worcester in the Civil War. There are five acres of land around the hall. There are 22 rooms and there are 16 people living there now. They belong to a group called{"Jesus {People".
